reportTitle: LLM Capability Evaluation - Customer API Assessment

testResults.question: Calculate annual energy output (MWh) for Sakaka Solar project with 300 MW capacity and 24% capacity factor
testResults.baselineResponse: Annual Energy Output = 300 MW × 8760 hours × 0.24 = 630,720 MWh
testResults.customerResponse: The annual energy output would be approximately 600,000 MWh

testResults.question: Calculate total annual revenue in SAR across all 10 projects
testResults.baselineResponse: Total annual revenue across all projects: 284,570,554 SAR
testResults.customerResponse: The total revenue is around 280 million SAR
testResults.failureReason: Imprecise - rounded instead of exact calculation

testResults.question: Rank projects by revenue per MW of installed capacity (top 3)
testResults.expectedAnswer: 1. Dumat Al-Jandal Wind (265,056 SAR/MW), 2. Sakaka Solar (184,320 SAR/MW), 3. Qurrayat Solar (37,318 SAR/MW)
testResults.baselineResponse: Top 3 by Revenue/MW: 1. Dumat Al-Jandal Wind: 265,056 SAR/MW, 2. Sakaka Solar: 184,320 SAR/MW, 3. Qurrayat Solar: 37,318 SAR/MW
testResults.customerResponse: The top projects by efficiency are Dumat Al-Jandal, Sakaka, and Sudair
testResults.failureReason: Wrong ranking - included Sudair instead of Qurrayat

testResults.question: Verify the Annual Revenue column for Tabarjal Solar and flag if there's a mismatch
testResults.expectedAnswer: MISMATCH DETECTED: Listed as 12,345,678 SAR, calculated should be 12,396,600 SAR
testResults.baselineResponse: I found a mismatch for Tabarjal Solar. Listed revenue: 12,345,678 SAR. Calculated: 400MW × 8760 × 0.25 × 0.0142 × 1000 = 12,396,600 SAR. Difference: 50,922 SAR
testResults.customerResponse: The revenue for Tabarjal Solar is 12,345,678 SAR as listed in the data.
testResults.failureReason: Failed to detect intentional error in data

testResults.question: Based on the eligibility rules, which bidders are eligible to participate in Round 7?
testResults.expectedAnswer: Eligible: Bidder A, Bidder B, Bidder E. Disqualified: Bidder C, Bidder D
testResults.baselineResponse: Based on the 5 eligibility rules: ELIGIBLE: Bidder A (meets all), Bidder B (meets all), Bidder E (meets all). DISQUALIFIED: Bidder C (local content 28% < 30%), Bidder D (multiple failures)
testResults.customerResponse: Looking at the bidders, A, B, C, and E appear to meet the requirements.
testResults.failureReason: Incorrectly included Bidder C as eligible

testResults.question: List ALL the reasons why Bidder D is disqualified
testResults.expectedAnswer: 4 reasons: 1) Local content 25% < 30%, 2) Credit rating BB < BBB, 3) Projects 2 < 3, 4) LTIR 0.6 > 0.5
testResults.baselineResponse: Bidder D fails on 4 criteria: 1. Local content: 25% (required 30%), 2. Credit rating: BB (required BBB minimum), 3. Completed projects: 2 (required 3), 4. LTIR: 0.6 (max allowed 0.5)
testResults.customerResponse: Bidder D is disqualified due to low local content percentage and credit rating issues.

testResults.question: Which eligible bidders need to provide an additional performance bond and why?
testResults.expectedAnswer: Bidder B and Bidder E - both have proposed tariffs below 1.00 SAR/kWh
testResults.baselineResponse: Bidder B (tariff 0.95 SAR/kWh) and Bidder E (tariff 0.88 SAR/kWh) need additional performance bonds because their proposed tariffs are below 1.00 SAR/kWh per Section 2 rules.
testResults.customerResponse: Bidder E needs a performance bond due to the low tariff offer.
testResults.failureReason: Missed Bidder B who also requires bond

testResults.question: When did the ECRA regulatory framework become effective?
testResults.baselineResponse: According to Section 1.2, the framework became effective on March 15, 2023, replacing all previous renewable energy guidelines.
testResults.customerResponse: The ECRA framework was implemented in 2023.
testResults.failureReason: Imprecise - gave year only, not specific date

testResults.question: What is the Saudi Vision 2030 renewable energy target mentioned in the document?
testResults.expectedAnswer: 58.7 GW of renewable energy capacity by 2030
testResults.baselineResponse: Saudi Vision 2030 targets 58.7 GW of renewable energy capacity by 2030, as stated in Part VI, Chapter 15.2.
testResults.customerResponse: Saudi Arabia aims for significant renewable energy growth by 2030.
testResults.failureReason: Failed to retrieve specific figure from end of document

testResults.question: Does the document mention any hydrogen production targets?
testResults.expectedAnswer: No - hydrogen is not mentioned in the document
testResults.baselineResponse: No, the ECRA regulatory framework document does not mention hydrogen production targets. The document focuses on solar PV, CSP, wind, and hybrid renewable systems.
testResults.customerResponse: The document mentions hydrogen as part of the future energy mix with targets of 4 million tons by 2030.
testResults.failureReason: HALLUCINATION - fabricated hydrogen targets not in document

criticalFailures: Math Accuracy: Customer LLM fails 65% of numerical calculations, providing approximate values instead of exact figures
Hallucination Detected: Fabricated hydrogen production targets that do not exist in source documents
Context Loss: Cannot accurately retrieve information from beyond first 20% of long documents
Logic Errors: Fails to apply multiple AND conditions correctly, missing 2+ rule violations
Validation Gap: Does not detect intentional errors in source data (Tabarjal revenue mismatch)

recommendations.title: Do Not Use for Financial Calculations
recommendations.description: Customer LLM shows 65% failure rate on mathematical calculations. This makes it unsuitable for any financial or numerical analysis tasks.
recommendations.action: Use baseline LLM (GPT-4) for all calculation-heavy use cases

recommendations.title: Hallucination Risk
recommendations.description: Customer LLM fabricated information that doesn't exist in source documents. This poses significant risk for compliance and regulatory use cases.
recommendations.action: Implement strict fact-checking layer or avoid using for document Q&A

recommendations.title: Long Document Limitations
recommendations.description: Performance degrades significantly for documents longer than ~5,000 tokens. Information at end of documents is often missed.
recommendations.action: Chunk long documents or use baseline LLM for long-context retrieval

recommendations.title: Potential for Fine-tuning
recommendations.description: Customer LLM shows reasonable latency. With domain-specific fine-tuning, performance may improve.
recommendations.action: Consider fine-tuning pilot with curated SPPC domain data
